intro: Tecticornia flabelliformis, commonly known as the flabelliform spinifex, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, succulent habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in harsh environments. Tecticornia flabelliformis is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is well-suited to drought conditions.
